revised_title: Morphology and Characteristics of the Trypanosome Causing Disease in Man in Nyasaland
tldr: The author studied the morphology and characteristics of the trypanosome causing disease in man in Nyasaland. They discovered that this strain of the trypanosome, now known as T. rhodesiense, has distinct features such as posterior nuclear forms and blunt, hippo-headed forms. This trypanosome is responsible for a disease different from the traditional Sleeping Sickness, and the author suggests using the native name "Kaodzera" to distinguish it.
